title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement codeofconduct@rstudio.com. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: A package to produce roles and responsibility maps
text: Eventually package may make CRAN, right now follow latest stable version development instructions . available, can installed directly CRAN. However, latest stable version () found GitHub, installed using devtools package. like install latest development version, may install develop branch.
code: install.packages("rolemapr") if (!require(devtools)) install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("whjelmar/rolemapr") if (!require(devtools)) install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("whjelmar/rolemapr", ref = "develop")

title: Configure report template — configure_report
text: function configures content --generated data profiling report.

title: Configure report template — configure_report
code: configure_report(   add_introduce = TRUE,   introduce_args = list(),   global_ggtheme = quote(theme_gray()),   global_theme_config = list() )

title: Configure report template — configure_report
text: add_introduce add introduce? Default TRUE. introduce_args arguments passed introduce. Default list(). global_ggtheme global setting theme.Default quote(theme_gray()). global_theme_config global setting theme. Default list().

title: Configure report template — configure_report
text: Individual settings overwrite global settings. example: intro_args ggtheme set theme_light() global_ggtheme set theme_gray(), theme_light() used. setting global themes using global_ggtheme, please pass unevaluated call theme function, e.g., quote(theme_light()).

title: Configure report template — configure_report
code: ## Get default configuration configure_report() #> $introduce #> list() #>   ## Set global theme configure_report(global_ggtheme = quote(theme_light(base_size = 20L))) #> $introduce #> list() #>

what: Group_by and count the occurances of a group in a data set — counts_fields
title: Group_by and count the occurances of a group in a data set — counts_fields
text: takes tibble field name group_by field counts results

title: Group_by and count the occurances of a group in a data set — counts_fields
Group_by and count the occurances of a group in a data set — counts_fields
text: data tibble count groups field_name name field group count

title: Group_by and count the occurances of a group in a data set — counts_fields
text: Group dataset field provide counts group

title: Group_by and count the occurances of a group in a data set — counts_fields
code: library(rolemapr) library(tibble)  practice_data <- tribble(    ~practice_area, ~role,    "Test area", "Test Role",  ) counts_fields(practice_data, "practice_area") #> # A tibble: 1 × 2 #> # Groups:   practice_area [1] #>   practice_area     n #>   <chr>         <int> #> 1 Test area         1

title: Create report — create_report
text: function creates data profiling report.

title: Create report — create_report
code: create_report(   data,   output_format = html_document(toc = TRUE, toc_depth = 6, theme = "yeti"),   output_file = "report.html",   output_dir = getwd(),   y = NULL,   config = configure_report(),   report_title = "Data Profiling Report",   ... )

title: Create report — create_report
text: data input data output_format output format render. Default html_document(toc = TRUE, toc_depth = 6, theme = "yeti"). output_file output file name render. Default "report.html". output_dir output directory report render. Default user's current directory. y name response variable . Response variables passed appropriate plotting functions automatically. config report configuration generated configure_report. report_title report title. Default "Data Profiling Report". ... arguments passed render.

title: Create report — create_report
text: config named list evaluated create_report. name exactly match function name. , function corresponding content added report. want include certain functions/content, add config. configure_report generates default template. may customize content using function. function arguments passed .call list.

title: Create report — create_report
text: y plot_prcomp present, y removed plot_prcomp. multiple options function, plotted. example, create_report(..., y = "", config = list("plot_bar" = list("" = "b"))) create 3 bar charts: regular frequency bar chart bar chart aggregated response variable "" bar chart aggregated variable "b"`

title: Create report — create_report
code: if (FALSE) { # Create report create_report(iris) create_report(airquality, y = "Ozone")  # Load library library(ggplot2) library(tibble) library(rmarkdown)  # Set some missing values diamonds2 <- tibble(diamonds) for (j in 5:ncol(diamonds2)) {   set(diamonds2,     i = sample.int(nrow(diamonds2), sample.int(nrow(diamonds2), 1)),     j,     value = NA_integer_   ) }  # Create customized report for diamonds2 dataset create_report(   data = diamonds2,   output_format = html_document(toc = TRUE, toc_depth = 6, theme = "flatly"),   output_file = "report.html",   output_dir = getwd(),   y = "price",   config = configure_report(     add_plot_prcomp = TRUE,     plot_qq_args = list("by" = "cut", sampled_rows = 1000L),     plot_bar_args = list("with" = "carat"),     plot_correlation_args = list("cor_args" = list("use" = "pairwise.complete.obs")),     plot_boxplot_args = list("by" = "cut"),     global_ggtheme = quote(theme_light())   ) )  ## Configure report without `configure_report` config <- list(   "introduce" = list(),   "plot_intro" = list(),   "plot_str" = list(     "type" = "diagonal",     "fontSize" = 35,     "width" = 1000,     "margin" = list("left" = 350, "right" = 250)   ),   "plot_missing" = list(),   "plot_histogram" = list(),   "plot_density" = list(),   "plot_qq" = list(sampled_rows = 1000L),   "plot_bar" = list(),   "plot_correlation" = list("cor_args" = list("use" = "pairwise.complete.obs")),   "plot_prcomp" = list(),   "plot_boxplot" = list(),   "plot_scatterplot" = list(sampled_rows = 1000L) ) }

what: Get data from an Excel file — get_excel_data
title: Get data from an Excel file — get_excel_data
text: wrapper around readxl::read_excel function get data Excel file.  convenience function using targets.  data cleaning functions moved clean_* set functions, may need exist anymore, left heritage purposes.

title: Get data from an Excel file — get_excel_data
Get data from an Excel file — get_excel_data
text: file relative path Excel data file. sheet_name name particular worksheet wish get data.  default Sheet1. skip_rows number rows sheet skip processing file.  default 0. allows user deal files rows contain data wish use analysis.

title: Describe basic information — introduce
text: Describe basic information input data class: rows: number rows columns: number columns discrete_columns: number discrete columns continuous_columns: number continuous columns all_missing_columns: number columns everything missing total_missing_values: number missing observations complete_rows: number rows without missing values. See complete.cases. total_observations: total number observations memory_usage: estimated memory allocation bytes. See object.size.
